page.title: 07Life in Upperton
page.content:
I live in Upperton which is the top part of Brightwell Baldwin. We have got one church and two farms. In one of the farms my mother has some calves, she feeds them morning and night. There is a pub called the Lord Nelson. There is also a shop that is going to close down just before christmas. When I go out I go and see my friends or get some shopping. Lots of people go or walks and bike rides. I like living in Uppeton. Thee are lots of things to o and the countryside here is very beautiful. In autumn the round is scattered with leaves and I collect lots of conkers. Sometimes in winter the school bus gets stuck in the snow. Lots of my friends ride so I ride out with them.
Katherine penning (age 9)
